ygData.subject: Zero-D kinetics in Python
ygData.msgSnippet: The latest version of zero-dimensional kinetics is now available for Python. Some brief documentation is at http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist/doc/zerod.pdf

Subject: Zero-D kinetics in Python

The latest version of zero-dimensional kinetics is now available for 
Python. Some brief documentation is at 
http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist/doc/zerod.pdf

In this version, you can:

  - work with networks of reactors

  - define reservoirs to provide constant inlet conditions

  - allow heat transfer between reactors
    * specified heat transfer coefficient, or
    * specified heat flux as a function of time

  - use different reaction mechanisms in different reactors,
    (even if one flows into the other)

  - define flexible or moving walls between reactors
    * volume change rate linear in Delta P, or
    * specified dV/dt as a function of time
    * heating/cooling due to adiabatic compression/expansion

  - connect reactors with flow lines
    * install mass flow controllers
    * install valves
  
  - create CSTRs, batch reactors, etc.


The documentation describes where to get the installation file for 
Windows. The source distribution (needed for every non-Windows 
platform) has not yet been updated, but will be in a day or so.
Several examples are described in the documentation, and two zero-D 
kinetics scripts are included among the example scripts.
